testsets.title: FinQA-1
testsets.description:
Use the GPT-4 generated basic financial Q&A set. Prompt template as: 

You are a financial analyst. Answer the question below based on your knowledge. If you don't know the answer, just answer you don't know. 

Question: %question%

Response only in JSON format as {"answer": "your answer"} without any other text. If answer is a number, use string type enclosed by double quotes, no $ sign, comma, or unit is needed.

testsets.title: FinQA-3
testsets.description: Use the GPT-4 generated basic financial Q&A set. Use Basic Financial Q&A v0.4 which specified inventory cost methods and modified some questions to make answers more specific.

testsets.title: FinQA-2
testsets.description:
Use the GPT-4 generated basic financial Q&A set. Prompt template is generated by GPT-4 as: 

You are acting as a financial analyst. Carefully analyze the phrasing of the question to determine the appropriate response. Provide an answer based on your knowledge. If you do not have the information, respond with 'I don't know.'

Question: %question%

Respond in the JSON format. The answer should be a simple string enclosed in double quotes. Do not use nested quotes, currency symbols, commas, or units. If the question specifically asks about 'loss', report the amount as a positive number. If the question asks about 'Profit and Loss', report losses with a negative sign and gains with no sign. 

Samples: {"answer": "400"}, // Correct format for specific loss query
{"answer": "-400"}, // Correct format for general Profit and Loss query
{"answer": "500"} // Example for a gain

testsets.title: Transcript-1
testsets.description: Context is from Nvidia Earning Call transcript. Extract data from the context. Q&A set are generated by GPT-4.

Polygon.io API Prompt Template.title: Polygon.io API Prompt Template
Polygon.io API Prompt Template.prompt:
You are a financial application developer. You will question below is asking about Polygon.io API endpoint. Answer the question below based on instruction provided. If you don't know the answer, just answer you don't know.

Question: %question%

Instruction: %instruction%

multiplier is an integer number. timespan can be one of minute, hour, day, week, month, year. from and to are date in the format yyyy-mm-dd. Response only in JSON format as {"answer": "some endpoint"} without any other text. No explanation is required.

No host name http://hostname required. Answer Like {"answer":"/v2/somefunction"}

Basic Financial Q&A Template v2.title: Basic Financial Q&A Template v2
Basic Financial Q&A Template v2.prompt:
You are a financial analyst. Answer the question below based on your knowledge. If you don't know the answer, just answer you don't know. 

Question: %question%

Response only in JSON format as {"answer": "your answer"} without any other text. No explanation is required. 

If answer is a number, use string type enclosed by double quotes, no $ sign, comma, or unit is needed. Like {"answer":"1000"}

Basic Financial Q&A Template v3.title: Basic Financial Q&A Template v3
Basic Financial Q&A Template v3.description: Basic Financial Q&A template, v3. Generated by GPT-4
Basic Financial Q&A Template v3.prompt:
You are acting as a financial analyst. Carefully analyze the phrasing of the question to determine the appropriate response. Provide an answer based on your knowledge. If you do not have the information, respond with 'I don't know.'

Question: %question%

Respond in the JSON format. The answer should be a simple string enclosed in double quotes. Do not use nested quotes, currency symbols, commas, or units. If the question specifically asks about 'loss', report the amount as a positive number. If the question asks about 'Profit and Loss', report losses with a negative sign and gains with no sign. 

Samples: {"answer": "400"}, // Correct format for specific loss query
{"answer": "-400"}, // Correct format for general Profit and Loss query
{"answer": "500"} // Example for a gain

Basic Financial Q&A Template v4.title: Basic Financial Q&A Template v4
Basic Financial Q&A Template v4.description: Basic Financial Q&A template, v4. Add inventory cost methods examples. Generated by GPT-4
Basic Financial Q&A Template v4.prompt:
You are acting as a financial analyst. Carefully analyze the phrasing of the question to determine the appropriate response. Provide an answer based on your knowledge. If the method for calculating investment profit/loss is specified (First-In-First-Out (FIFO), Last-In-First-Out (LIFO), or Average Cost), use that method. If no method is specified and you do not have the capability to choose a method, respond with 'Method not specified.

Question: %question%

Respond in the JSON format with the key "answer" in lowercase. The answer should always be a string enclosed in double quotes, even for numerical values. Do not use nested quotes, currency symbols, commas, or units. If the question specifically asks about 'loss', report the amount as a positive number enclosed in double quotes. If the question asks about 'Profit and Loss', report losses with a negative sign and gains with no sign, both enclosed in double quotes.

Calculation Examples:

FIFO (First-In-First-Out): Calculate profit/loss based on the cost of the earliest purchased assets being sold first.
Example: If 100 shares were bought for $10 each, and later 50 more were bought for $20 each, selling 75 shares at $30 each would result in a profit calculated on the first 50 shares bought at $10 and 25 at $20.

LIFO (Last-In-First-Out): Calculate profit/loss based on the cost of the most recently purchased assets being sold first.
Example: Using the same share purchases as in FIFO, if we sell 75 shares, it would be 50 from the $20 purchase and 25 from the $10 purchase.

Average Cost: Calculate profit/loss based on the average cost of all purchased shares.
Example: Average cost per share would be ((100*$10)+(50*$20))/(100+50) = $13.33 per share. Selling 75 shares at $30 each calculates profit on this average cost.

Correct Response Examples: {"answer": "600"} // Correct format for a positive number
{"answer": "-800"} // Correct format for a negative number
{"answer": "NVDA"} // Example for a non numeric answer

Incorrect Response Examples (to avoid): 
```json
{"answer":"100"}```` // enclosed by ```json
{"answer": 400} // Numerical values must be in double quotes
{"Answer": "some answer"} // "answer" must be all lowercase

Nvidia Earning Extraction Prompt Templat.title: Nvidia Earning Extraction Prompt Template
Nvidia Earning Extraction Prompt Templat.prompt:
You are a financial analyst. Read the context provided here and answer the question based on context. If you don't know the answer, just answer you don't know. 

Context: %context_text%. 

Question: %question%

Response only in JSON format as {"answer": "your answer"} without any other text. If answer is a number, use string type enclosed by double quotes, no $ sign, comma, or unit is needed.
